title: Police Officer Who Shot Jay Anderson in Milwaukee Suburb in 2016 to Be Prosecuted
sub_head: Court will appoint special prosecutor to lead case against officer who was involved in three fatal shootings over five years
body:
A Wisconsin judge has ruled that police officer Joseph Mensah can be prosecuted for the 2016 killing of Jay Anderson, a black man whose fatal shooting sparked protests last year.
Milwaukee County Circuit Court Judge Glenn Yamahiro said Wednesday there was probable cause that Mr. Mensah operated a weapon in a manner constituting criminal negligence.
On the night of the shooting, Mr. Anderson was asleep in his car in a park in the Milwaukee suburb of Wauwatosa after a night of drinking with friends in celebration of his birthday. Mr. Mensah, who is also Black, stopped to question him and shot him through the passenger window, firing at least six times.
Police say Mr. Anderson lunged for a gun on the passenger seat. Available dashcam evidence was inconclusive.
Mr. Andersonâ€™s family deny he lunged for a gun, and question whether a weapon was on the passenger seat in the first place. They say police tampered with the crime scene before the investigation. Mr. Anderson had a one-year-old baby at the time with his girlfriend.
